mdRecord.dcterms:title: The Home of Washington. As it appeared May 14, 1859
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Israel & Riddle
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Salt paper print in original mount with lithographed decorative border, title and date all in gilt, with printed text: 'Gift No. 139. The Home of Washington. As it appeared May 14th 1859. Photographed by Israel & Riddle. Expressly for H. E. Hoyt & Co., No. 41 Baltimore Street, Baltimore, Md.' View of the Mount Vernon Mansion was taken from a northeast perspective and shows the masts of ships used to prop up the roof after several columns on the piazza had rotted away. Standing with one arm resting upon a white-painted board fence protecting a small tree is a man wearing a dark suit and top hat. Issued as 'Gift No. 139' for purchase of a book from H. E. Hoyt & Co.'s gift book store in Baltimore, Maryland. Gift book stores offered a prize with each purchased volume. Each book had a number or code on it corresponding to a random prize.
